Overall, it wasn't horrible, but it just wasn't real Vietnamese food to me.  
Maybe I'm even more critical just because I'm Vietnamese & grew up in the East Bay & was only 20min from SJ (both of which have Viet food that is 1000000x better than SF).  

I ordered the bun bo hue & whatever came out was definitely not bun bo hue. 
It seemed to be just spicy pho maybe?  
There was no pork meat, no pork blood, no bones... It was sad. 
On top of that, they didn't bring out the veggies that come with bun bo hue. 
No, they didn't forget nor did they just not have it - apparently, you have to specifically ASK in order to get it. 
Really? Maybe I just look young, as though I don't know what real bbh consists of, but in my opinion, YOU SHOULD BRING IT ALL OUT ANYWAYS!

My boyfriend ordered the pho & it was alright. 
That was the only thing deserving of SOME stars. 

Even though Y&Y is close to where we live, I'd still rather drive all the way down to 36th & Balboa to go to Kim Son.
author: Sylvia N.

description: My favorite go-to Vietnamese restaurant in the city! Very tasty pho soup & great tasting beef.
author: Millicent L.

description:
This has easily become my go-to pho place!

- Pho-joint prices
- Good quality (really!)
- Extended variety in the menu
- Friendly staff
- Easy parking everytime I've come
- Clean restaurant

I always felt that most pho joints were created (mostly) equal..
until l came here and realized that most places I'd been to before
were quite mediocre in comparison. 
I've never been to their original sister location, but I'm glad this one is so close!
After coming here a few times, I've noticed that their food is really consistent,
which I appreciate.. the rare steak is rare, the noodles aren't stuck together
at the bottom of my bowl, the spring rolls don't feel like they've been sitting
in the fridge all day.  

Bonus star for playing canto/viet/mandarin songs from my childhood that
I actually remember... Yes, all pre-F4 (or whichever sensation is out now).
author: Jade T.

description: Loved the bun and pho here and they paired well with a Tiger beer--best since being in Vietnam and I live near Little Saigon and have Vietnamese food often, so that's saying a lot!
author: Cynthia O.

description:
Weekends have become our brunch date days. bf has to work around noon so we try to grab some food before he goes.

looked up vietnamese place around this area and got this, sister restaurant of Yummy yummy? Sold

Luckily found parking right at the corner, place was empty at 11am on a sunday. (of course we were lucky cuz half an hour later, place was full and service was rush as it was mainly one guy)

ordered the
egg rolls- pretty good, they give you some noodles and lettuce to eat with it, like a wrap.
banh xeo- prettyyy good, really crispy, and had lots of veggies and shrimp and meat inside. 
we were pretty full from here...always ordering tooo much!!
bf got the com thit nuong
and I got the #59? the one with everything, rice, meat, shrimp, egg, egg roll....
yea we didn't finish and to-goed it, but the pork was yummy! i would have definitely eaten it all if I didn't want to leave with food coma!

clean restaurant, vietnamese music playing and video of things in vietnam. prices are normal. would come back if in the area
author: Christine M.

description: Rarely give comment but this time is worth. Love at first sight with Banh Cuon and Pho Dac Biet. Will be back next time for more.
author: 伟浩

description: I was having a vermicelli noodle craving and instead of turning to my GO-TO restaurant to fulfill my craving, we were in the neighborhood and decided to try this place out, considering it has a 4 star rating. I ordered #45 vermicelli with 5-spice chicken and imperial rolls. It wasn't terrible, but definitely doesn't top my GO-TO place, which by the way is PPQ on Irving. The chicken was seasoned right, but somehow not cooked the way I liked it, and the imperials rolls kinda sucked. In addition, the restaurant didn't seem very clean. The menu was kind of sticky, had to wash my hands after ordering my food.
author: Amy X.

description:
We have been to a few Vietnamese places in San Francisco, and this is one of our favorites. It is encouraging that such a small restaurant could have a very diverse menu while maintaining good quality of every dishes. 

My favorite dishes are Bun Bo Hue (a bit spicy) & Bun Rieu Cua (Crab Noodle Soup - this dish is quite hard to find). The grilled pork rice was also very good - the pork was tender, well-seasoned and was grilled with charcoal (Vietnamese style).

The staffs were friendly and nicely allowed us to merge tables to accommodate more people. Please notice that parking is pretty hard to find on Clement street.
author: Phuong N.

description: Love the #27 - Rare beef flank w/meetballs. Also the 5 spice chicken vermicelli bowl is also a classic.
author: Ruby R.

description: Y&Y is owned by the same people as Yummy Yummy on Irving I believe; which happens to be one of my favorite Vietnamese spots in the Bay. Service is always great here; very accommodating and friendly. Love the food as well, my favorite dishes from here is their Bun Rieu and Bun Bo Hue. I like how it's more authentic than the other places I've been to in the city. Great serving size for the price!
author: Brian T.

description:
Yummy Yummy's sister restaurant. Or brother restaurant? Estranged cousin restaurant. Either way, they're related and each one is super good.

Came here a couple times. The first time I ordered the bun bo hue, my go-to hangover dish. It was relatively spicy and really flavorful. Easily my favorite bbh in the city so far. I still have a lot of places to try, but so far this one takes the cake. Prepare for your sinuses to be cleared!

I came here a second time ordered the pho with all the fixins. I was not disappointed. Once again, the broth was super flavorful and I was really satisfied. I kind of wish they put a little more meat in there, but honestly the flavor was so good I didn't care that much. I drank a good amount of the broth!! Mmmmm salt water.

Downside: poor service. And relatively slow. 

I can def see myself coming back here. I would recommend it to anyone!
author: Jade R.

description:
Y & Y was packed for lunch, each table ordering either noddles, pho, or some rice dish. 10ish tables fill out this hole in the wall. better known as yummy yummy  on irving, banh mi is one of their specialities 

eats: house combo banh mi sandwish(4)
-pate, different cuts of fresh pork, ham, with daikon, jalepeno, carrots, sprounts, etc.
-fresh tasting, msg not noticeable

crumbs:
-waitress made banh mi at a station just behind counter.
-no "space" to wait for order,  just standing around.
-semi open kitchen, can see pho, entrees being prepped while waiting.
-pho seems interesting.
author: Victor G.

description:
Yummy Yummy sister restaurant. This place is smaller and cheaper, but only because the portions are smaller. 

Got the usual egg rolls, raw beef salad, clams, and the chicken wings. Those were pretty good with onions and lemon grass.

The chicken pho with clear noodles. The broth is soooooooooooooooooooooo good....what's Turtle Tower again? I will be back just for this. Delish!
author: Karen H.

description:
I had their Banh beo (circle flour cakes) and it was delicious. Very different from what I've had before since they top it with Bi (shredded pork) and cha lua (fancy pork- they call it).
 
I'd go back to try the other items
author: Vanae W.

description: LOVE this place!!  I was sad when the $1 sushi (Weds Nights) place closed, but I'm SOOOOOO happy that Y&Y moved in!  The noodles are always delicious, the Bahn Mi (Sandwiches) are the best in the city, and the owner is cute as a button.  It's the same owner as the previous Y&Y location - they closed for a while and reopened here.  Been trying to get that updated with Yelp, but have had no luck (regardless of the fact that I was an Account Executive at Yelp for over 2 years).  Oh well.  Doesn't change the fact that this place is A MA ZING.
author: Cori D.

description: Very solid Vietnamese in the Inner Richmond.  The line can get a little long, and the service a little brusque, but the prices are great and it is close to home.  I usually go for a vermicelli bowl... light, cool, fresh. The Imperial Rolls are solid. We also drop in on National Chicken Wing Day and had some nice wings with lemon grass and a little spice.
author: Kathryn E.

description: it's not worth to try, people. If you like more noodles in one order, you should not choose this place. The price of the food is not even match with the quantity of the food. People , this is the truth!
author: Crystal T.

description:
Banh canh cua.

Hearts and smiley faces and love and rainbows.

Pretty much the same thing, in my book.
author: Tori S.

description: This is our favorite Pho place. We come out from silver terrace area to eat here when we can. They are quick but busy. It is worth it.
author: Sarah P.

description: BOMB pho! Reasonably priced as well. The thing that stands out the most about this spot is the meat. It melts in your mouth!
author: Daniel A.

description: This place hits the spot on a cold rainy SF day.  We had some spicy pho, regular beef pho, and spring rolls.  All were excellent and were filling.  Price is reasonable and quality solid.  Will be back regularly I think.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Decent pho since this was a random entry during lunch time.  They were accommodating with a child too. 

Pho $7.25 for a large. 
Fried rolls were $5.25.  

I'd come back if I were in the area; but then again there are a few pho shops along this street.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
Y&Y is a sister restaurant of Yummy Yummy on Irving St. I personally think Yummy Yummy is much better than Y&Y on quality and service. Since this location is close to grocery stores, I am a regular. 

Satay Beef Noodles: Soup was not hot enough. They boiled the bean sprouts without asking us. Well, I prefer my bean sprouts crisp and raw. I don't understand why they never ask me how I want my bean sprouts. At the Irving St location, they always ask. When we asked for another plate of raw bean sprouts, the server said we can only give one plate per a bowl of noodles. I take out one star for that. 

Service: The other two young dudes are pretty good, but the lady is the worst.  She didn't greet us when we entered the restaurant and didn't look at us when we ordered. She walked away before we finished ordering all the food. When we asked for more chili pepper, the lady got annoyed and said 'OK. OK. I hear you.'  I take out one star for service.
author: J L.

description: Arrived at 8.40 and was told they were closed. I asked when they close... "8.45" Wasn't even going to argue because they obviously weren't interested in my business. According to Yelp, they close at 9pm. Lady who told me they were closed was surly and rude. Wouldn't want to eat here anyway... She'd probably spit in my soup.
author: Jen H.

description: Polite Workers there, perfect customer sercive except one short girl who looks like a manager. I used to go there a lot as a regular customer that short mean girl asks my id every time i order beer.(are you serious) Now i dont even order one anymore. She has no conversation with me whatsoever. She walks up to me with no facial expression. I tell her what i want. She wrote down, turned around and walked away. I am totally cool with that. I just do not give tips to her. The other guys are super polite. I say thank you. they always reply back you are welcome. no matter how many times. I am coming back for the guys not that girl.
author: Ken C.

description:
Instead of driving to Sunset for a good hangover cure at Yummy Yummy, I decided to venture out to Richmond district to try something new. By chance, I came across a review for Y&Y and realized they are the same owners as Yummy Yummy(Y&Y, go figure)

I usually order my typical pho soup with sliced meat on the side and tendons. The one thing I remember about Yummy Yummy was their flavorful broth and their second location had that same umami flavor. 

I was going to give them 4 stars but the service was not up to par and we waited about 15min for our bowls of soup, which seemed like an eternity when you are hungover lol.

Food Highlight: Their Carpaccio and Pho broth.
author: Rich L.

description:
The owner's the wife of Yummy Yummy on Irving. So their food is pretty similar.

I like how they have a few different items. 

Good noodle soups, not just beef pho, they have bun bo hue, bun rieu, etc.
author: Erica L.

description: I was in the area, and trying to get over a cold...what a gem tucked in the Richmond.  We walked up Clement looking for a Pho place, and ran across Y & Y.  My friend ordered a pork and beef Pho bowl, while I ordered the Pho Ga.  We both enjoyed the Pho very much, I really liked how much toasted garlic flakes the bowl had.  Our server immediately brought us a pot of tea that kept us warm on this rainy day before the food arrived.  The decor is nice, and all the tables were filled.  I hope to come back soon to try other things on the menu.  I recommend this spot for a bowl of soup if you're near the Richmond district.
author: Marlon T.

description:
This place is awesome! Clean, cheap and everything on the menu is delicious!!!
The people who own and work here are very friendly and they get packed on rush hours.
The waiting is not too bad I usually get seated in 5 to 10 minutes.
I am glad this restaurant is within walking distance from my home!
My fav is the five spice chicken and beef ball noodle pho!
author: Ty N.

description:
25 Minute Wait!
Came here with my fiance.We thought we'd try a different place for our pho fix. We were seated within 5 minutes after arrival. We sat waiting to have our order to be taken. 10 mins pass and no one came to take our orders?!? I flag done one of the two  waiters to take our order and he says just a minute. He goes to the back and comes back and passes our table to clean a table just vacated! He walls back and ignores us. The second waiter comes by and we flag him down. He also tells us to wait! Now by this time, 2 people have walked in for take ourt orders, and the newly cleaned table is now being seated by a couple who came in! Still no waiter! Now a second table is being cleaned up! We just left!
 If I could, no stars at all!! Went back to our usual place, Good Noodle! Seated right when we got in. Order given and within 10 seconds, we had our appetizer. 1 minute and my drink and our two orders of pho!
author: V. P.

description: Maybe it's because I am Vietnamese and my mom happens to make bombtastic pho AND I am from San Jose, but this place really doesn't cut it for me.  The atmosphere is very relaxed and quaint and our waiter was really accommodating considering they were so busy on a Sunday morning.  The food took a pretty long time to arrive and I had the bun bo hue.  It was full of meat (a plus if you like your noodles full of meat ) and a bit bland for bun bo hue.  Overall it was very ok in all aspects and I supposed for the price I can't really complain.
author: Lana T.

description:
Decent Vietnamese restaurant with the exception of a certain annoying child of the owner who repeated "mommy, mommy, mommy" absolutely incessantly. Please make her stop. 

Otherwise, their bun bo hue is just ok. The lemongrass broth could be spicier, and they served it with a lemon in lieu of the standard lime. Unfortunately their cuts of beefy were very chewy. Hm. 

However the interiors are nicer than most Vietnamese restaurants and service is excellent. And the fact they had Lord of the Rings playing in TNT doesn't hurt either...
author: Shirley Y.

description:
Mmmm delicious!!! I've been to a few Vietnamese places and this one is by far one of the cleanest... And you can taste the freshness in the food! 

I would recommend trying the clams, five spice chicken and imperial rolls with rice vermicelli and the fried chicken wings with fish sauce!
author: Jerry S.

description: Absolutely love this place. It's a small joint down on Irving st and the line is out the door. Although the weight is long and you can't make reservations, it is undoubtly worth it. Food is authentic, high quality, and fresh out of the kitchen. I've never been disappointed eating here and it is a place in which I get excited about when I hear it's name. I go there casually or on special occasions, it is very flexible. Worth the trip hands down.
author: GianCarlo L.

description:
Eating lunch/dinner around 4:30 is not my usual habit. It came about by eating a very late breakfast and wanting to cut down on food intake. 4:30 can be a tricky time in San Francisco, your options are limited as to what's open for dinner. Sure, we could wait until 5 for more variety, but I was hungry, dammit!

Y&Y Vietnamese is relatively new to the neighborhood, and frequently full, making me think it's gotta be good. Sure enough, the place was full, so we had to wait about 10 minutes to get a table. 
Service is alright, dishes come out somewhat quickly.

Five-spice chicken with vermicelli - delicious, well-flavored chicken, atop a huge portion of vermicelli. There was enough to share with another person, and still have leftovers for later that night.

Raw Beef salad - a fresh take on steak tatare. Large slices of raw beef covered with fresh mint, basil, lemon juice, onions and a vinegar dipping sauce. delicious!

The Banh Mi sandwich should be skipped. There are plenty of vietnamese sandwich shops within a 5 block radius, and Y&Y doesn't specialize in sandwiches, the meat was tough, and simply not well made.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
Hmmm...I don't get it.  I tried there chicken pho (aka pho ga) and I wasn't impressed.  There are peeps who rave how good their soup is and how it's almost as good as Turtle Tower.  

Can I just say - no it isn't.  I wouldn't say their pho ga is terrible, but definitely not in the same league as Turtle Tower. The chicken soup just didn't grab me.  Their soup kind of reminded me of something out of a can unfortunately.  

Was I disappointed? Yep - I was.  So disappointed that I went to Turtle Tower for the pho ga later that day.  Only after that second bowl of pho ga was I satisfied.
author: Cris H.

description:
I've had both take out and eaten there - and I've only ever had soups. But EVERY TIME I leave thinking Dang! That's the best pho I've ever had!
Their Five Spice Chicken Noodle Soup is the perfect antidote to cold and dreary SF midsummer days.
Touched by the hand of the Soup Gods.
author: Kat B.

description: Sister restaurant of yummy yummy? Yup, finally got to try and it did not lived up the reputation it precedes. As someone mentioned below, it's cheaper and smaller? Smaller, that's for sure. The food is just mediocre. The famous lemongrass wings is just not the same. The bun rieu soup tasted nothing but the tomato..not authentic. Oh they charge for extra basil and cilantro ;(
author: Karen T.

description:
I will find any excuse to enjoy this sweet salty treat on a chilly afternoon, and Y & Y is one of my favorite places to get it. I went through a phase where I honestly believed that a bowl of Pho could ease any ill. Catch me on a day where a cold is creepin' and I will swear by it. 

It's love in a bowl.
author: Jocelyn B.

description: Great pho! close to my house! Lemon beef to die for! My spot! I was a duke at one point :)
author: Brent W.

description:
...New to the neighborhood! Was craving some hot pho. My boyfriend and I took a walk and stumbled on to this gem. Excited to have found a go-to pho place! We had the shrimp spring rolls-- YUM. I had veggie pho--DELISH! And the boyfriend had beef pho--NOM. Fresh, filling AND decent prices. Monday night date night was a success! 

We will be back!
author: Chelsey D.

description: Terrible delivery service l. Restaurant employees informed me that food was on its way for delivery to my home when the driver didn't have our address. A informed 40 min delivery turned into waiting over a hour and half.
author: Benny L.

description: If there is a negative score, I would give it to the restaurant. I was there 15 minutes before noon. There were six people waiting outside the restaurant which was pretty full with one empty table and three chairs. When I indicated that I was alone, they told me to sign up on the sheet. I saw the party of six on the list. That must be the party waiting outside. No one else's was waiting but me and the party of six, but they wouldn't seat me at that empty table. When I asked how long the wait time would be, the waiter just shrugged. Then I left.
author: shan t.

description: I love this place.  It just helped me not get sick.  When I am feeling like I am getting the plague that is going around, I opt for Pho to help me out.  It helped, but I also discovered this place.  Delicious broth and they also have banh bot chien..which is SO good.  I will drive over the bridge to Clement just for this.
author: Lisa M.

description: It was one those San Francisco cold nights and I was craving for Pho after drinking all day at an amazing Yelp Grape Gatsby Party.  I'm writing this review based on the Vegetarian pho and the vegetarian spring rolls.  The broth tasted healthy and hot and came with plenty of vegetables.  I'm quite sure they don't have extra added MSG since I didn't feel sick and sleepy after slurping up this delicious bowl of hot soup.  The spring rolls were ok nothing too spectacular.  It was rolled with vegetables, vermicelli noodles and little pieces of mushrooms and the dipping sauce was just soy sauce and lime juice which I thought was a little bland.  I think next time I will just stick to the pho which I thought was quite tasty.
author: Sharon N.

description: Best Vietnamese pho in San Fran that we could find! The Vietnamese bun is on point and is definitely a great appetizer to split amongst friends!
author: Eric N.

description: Y Y stands for yum yum. Small spot packed full of freshness and deliciousness. My grilled pork with rice a perfect blend of spicy sweetness with a touch of char. Spicy beef and pork pho awesome. Definitely a destination to come back again and again.
author: Matt A.

description: I think if a place is still busy and packed way beyond normal lunch hours (say like 3pm when we rolled in), it's a pretty good bet the food is good, and probably legit. The food was pretty good, with a solid pho and tasty vermicelli. Also, while we were eating a few tables down there was an elderly Chinese couple having lunch with what may or may not have been BYO wine. I love a place that does that.
author: Allie Y.

description:
I was hoping this would be a good, low key pho joint but it was a bit of a disappointment.

First, the good - The fried chicken wings were truly delicious. Perfectly fried and coated with sticky sweet/salty sauce, topped with a bunch of sautéed onions, it was the best thing I tried at Y&Y. 

The bad - The pho. So I'm not Vietnamese and I can't judge on what is truly authentic. But I've had the chance to eat at many Vietnamese restaurants in Garden Grove and San Jose with my Vietnamese friends. The broth at Y&Y is the first time I tasted broth that felt "wrong". It was different than any both I've tasted before and it wasn't the good kind of different. The taste was overpowered with something weird making me think they did not balance this broth right.

The OK- Bun Bo Hue. This packed a punch and it was great for the rainy day, but not the best I've had.

I'll probably never come back here unless I lived close by. I suggest trying somewhere else, unless you are close and too lazy to go somewhere else.
author: Julie K.

description:
My boyfriend and I always see long lines at this place on the weekends and thought we should check it out. Let it be known that we've been here twice in one week because it was so good the first time.  

I got banh canh, and he got mien ga. They were both DELICIOUS! You can taste distinct differences between the broths and know they use different recipes for all their other soups too. 

I recommend getting banh canh if you aren't too hungry because you can always bring it home and eat the leftovers later. The noodles don't expand like pho noodles. 

The mien ga broth was a little sweeter than the banh canh. Don't really believe they use MSG because I wasn't dehydrated after. 

The second time, I got bun rieu - it was okay; probably won't be getting it again anytime soon. I also tried the bun bo kho which was really good. I think it would taste better with bread, but the noodles are still wonderful. 

There always seems to be good street parking, which is always a perk to me. 

Even though the service isn't the best, like most Asian restaurants, this is by far my favorite Vietnamese noodle place in the city. Believe they're Chinese owned because one of the servers doesn't even know the food names. But, I'm sure they'll start remembering me soon. ;)
author: Mimi V.

description: Came here on a colder day. The place is small and casual; good for a quick bite. The food and the service were great. Loved the rare beef pho and charcoal beef. Note, the menu is not very big and has only the most common vietnamese dishes (not everything).
author: Uma M.

description: Don't order chicken curry over rice. The chicken was tough and unappetizing, not nearly enough potatoes, and the broth was soupy thin. Everything else I have ever ordered was great, especially grilled meats.
author: Quincy S.

description: The pho itself was good but the one pho bowl I got was like sauce and noodles instead of soup and noodles. I personally didn't like it. It was the spicy rare beef pho. The "soup" was more like curry and very powdery. My boyfriend had the seafood pho and that soup was really good. I would go back again but get something different.
author: Justina J.

description:
New to the neighborhood.  I guess it will be hard to find comparable vietnamese food, since I am coming from San Jose.

I love banh mi's!  The best spot is off Senter in SJ.  But the bare minimum I expect out of a banh mi are pickled veggies and pate.  Most importantly, the pate.  

These sandwiches do not come with pate.
author: Christina C.

description: This place is insanely good.  I stopped by on my way to the groomers and was not disappointed.  I felt good about my decision when I noticed the place was packed with Asians lol.  Got the #2 shrimp spring rolls and the #49 beef vermicelli, my two favorite Vietnamese dishes.  Vermicelli MIGHT be the best I've ever had: great flavor, fresh ingredients, and REAL, smokey, charbroiled-to-perfection, tasty, quality beef strips.  The shrimp spring rolls did not include any of that bland, cardboardy, gross grey pork that no one asked to be in there that some other places throw into your shrimp spring roll.  And the peanut sauce tastes just how you want it to.  Five stars, can't wait to be back.
author: Lisa L.

description: Awesome menu. Chicken vermicelli was flavorful and perfectly done, noodles were fresh!
author: Hila S.

description: Delish! Ordered online ahead of time and I walked in and it was already prepared waiting for me! Definitely will be back :)
author: Sarah S.

description: The customer service wasn't very good and the food was decent. The boba was really good, I had the avocado shake. I have definitely had better pho though. Denver is definitely in first place when it comes to pho. My dad had a grilled beef rice plate. The grilled beef was amazing, but the rice was a bit dry. Also the meat in the pho didn't taste the best. Overall it was okay, but I wouldn't come back.
author: Destiny T.

description:
Highlights: 
- Yay, sister restaurant of Yummy Yummy finally opened in my hood! 
- Rice rolls (banh cuong (sp?)) are the best and my favorite! 
- Love their grass jelly coconut drink. 
- Five spice chicken pho is different. Chicken doesn't have the crispy skin like most place, but really flavorful and on the side. 

Improvements: 
- Crab tomato noddle soup (Bun Rieu): Extremely flavored, I could do with a bit less and sometimes the meat is inconsistently salty. 
- Less items on their menu than Yummy Yummy, sad. :( 

Tip: I've learned that their clipboard wait-list is pretty useless. Just show your face and make sure they know you are waiting for a table.
author: Tracy T.

description: omg this pho...after a night of drinking, pho for breakfast sounded bomb. We came on a Saturday morning and it was already packed. Service was really fast, and I ordered the combination meat pho! It came out pretty fast and man.. the broth was so clear and tasted so clean! I was impressed by the quality of the meat as well. def cured my hangover.. if i lived in SF this would be my go to!!!
author: Sarah S.

description: OMG this place is horrible. My "mixed veggies" was a pile of cabbage. My sister couldn't even eat hers, shrimp and noodles, because it looked and tasted so bad. First time ever I have been in a restaurant where they refused to switch it out with another dish. Although it probably was just as well, it would have been equally as bad.
author: Chad C.

description:
Bún Bòn Hue thieu rau cai, nuoc béo thì quá man và không có ngot mùi thit chút nào het.
Pho cung vay nuoc béo gì mà man voi chua và không có mùi Pho gì het. Không có nuoc béo hành nham. Mat tien mà lai không ngon chút nào. 

I will never come again. Bún bò hue is wrong style at all, does not taste like Bún bò hue, the soup is too salty. Missing many side vegetable.
Pho is bad taste too, the soup is too salty and sour. The soup is the most important for the pho. Does not taste like pho at all.
author: JL L.

description: Probably the worst Vietnamese food I have eaten. I ordered through Eat24, maybe they don't care about Eat24 customers because the food was simply awful. Never again.
author: nick v.

description: Two words - food poisoning. Last time I felt this bad after a meal was in Vietnam. A little too authentic for my taste.
author: Sydney G.

description: Filling, fast, delicious  and cheap! What more can you ask for. I was craving it so badly that I ate my beef brisket pho while my friend was driving the car! Lol A go to place for pho.
author: Akina L.

description:
Tasty food, quick service and reasonable prices. 

Loved the ngheu xao la que (viet grilled clams). Grilled clams with peanuts, green onions and  garlicky fish sauce. Yummm!!!!! Pair it with an ice cold 33 and you are in business!
author: Cec D.

description: One of my to-go places if I don't feel like walking all the way to Cafe Bun Mi for some Vietnamese food. This place use to be the small shop inside the grocery store on 8th and Clement and now has expanded to be its own little restaurant. There food here is pretty good with having the choices of pho, vermicelli, rice plates, sandwiches and more. I've come here numerous times and typically get there vermicelli and its not bad but its too much noodle, not enough meat/vegetables. There noodle soups are a huge block of noodle at the bottom with soup poured on top but the soup base itself is bomb. I would say come here if you're looking for cheap but quick pho but be careful especially on the weekends because this place gets packed!
author: Angela S.

description: This street is full of great, cheap restos so you can't be a slacker and expect to survive here. The service and quality are top-notch. The BBQ pork stands out, but the Mango Pudding is a bit flavorless. Get you desserts elsewhere.
author: Phillip M.

description:
Love this place! I think this is probably one of my favorite pho places. 

What I love about Y&Y:
1. Chicken noodle soup with flat noodles
2. No cilantro! (It's on the veggie plate for those who like that dish soap herb) 
3. They put fried garlic in the chicken noodle soup (more flavor)
4. Clean and good service

I've been here many times but I can't seem to order anything else except chicken noodle soup because I love it so much!
author: Carmen C.

description: I came here with my boyfriend's family following the graduation of his younger cousin. I found out Y&Y is the sister restaurant of Yummy Yummy on Irving. Unfortunately I didn't like Yummy Yummy because their broth tasted a bit oily and sweet, which doesn't sit well with my taste buds. I decided to try something different and ordered the banh canh cua. I had no idea the broth would be thick nor sour. It wasn't my favorite but I can't knock on the fact that it's thick because I think that's how it should be. the noodles were otherwise tender and a good amount of chewiness.
author: Connie C.

description: I ordered the tomato crab noodle soup. I was a little disappointed because the soup was oily and not very flavorful. I had to scoop the oil off the the top. The service was ok but we were rushed at the end to make room for a bigger party.
author: Annie M.

description: Got the pho with tripe, flank, and meatballs! It was great! Not the best pho I've ever had but definitely one of the best in SF. They give you a ton of sides as well, bean sprouts, basil, etc. I also had the Vietnamese coffee and it was great!
author: Victoria G.

description:
After initially wanting to get some eat-in dim sum, and seeing a long ass wait for House of Banquet, we decided to try out Y and Y instead since we had already put an hour on the meter. I've never had Yummy Yummy before (on Irving), but have heard so-so reviews about it.

Between the three of us, we ordered:
Banh Xeo (Vietnamese Crepe)
Spring Rolls
Banh Canh Cua
Bun Bo Hue
Grilled Pork Vermicelli
Banh Beo with Cha Lua

The banh xeo wasn't as crispy as we would have liked, although the portion was big. However, after digging into it, we realized that there was hardly any meat/shrimp in it. The filling consisted mostly of bean sprout.. meat to bean sprout ratio was like 1:100 practically. I understand that this is not home, and you can't stuff your banh xeo to the brim in the interest of making money, but at least ground up some pork and spread it out or something... the fish sauce was too sweet for our tastes.

Spring Rolls: Decent size, only came with shrimp. I'm used to having both the sliced pork belly AND shrimp in my spring rolls. You're already slicing the shrimp in half, throw in some pork belly slices! (Although, we may have accidentally ordered spring rolls that only came with shrimp? Not sure.)

Banh Canh Cua: The soup had a weird consistency, and was very bland. Not much to say about this dish.

Bun Bo Hue: When this came out first, we all thought, "Ooooh". It looked very promising. Deep red soup base with tons of spices, 3 slices of the cha lua (pork cake), couple cubes of pork blood, and some pork meat. The broth ended up being really bland, despite the red coloring and abundance of spices floating around. The pork, however, was really tender, and you could tell they slow cooked it in the bland broth.

Grilled Pork Vermicelli: I didn't personally get a taste of this, but according to my sister, it was decent. Pork had good smokey flavor and was tender. The only thing is that the fish sauce they make here is a little too sweet for our tastes, so that negatively affects the other dishes that include fish sauce.

Banh Beo with Cha Lua: Decent. Not much to say about it...

Overall: The bill for these 6 dishes came out to be $47.xx, which isn't that bad. This is more of a 2.5 star, but I'm going to round up because the service was very friendly and accomodating (although they did not speak Vietnamese).

I understand they used to have a Vietnamese sandwich store located in a nearby supermarket... maybe we should have tried the sandwiches.
author: Munnie T.

description: I had lunch yesterday for the first time at Y & Y - It was fantastic!  The food was fresh and delicious, and their fish sauce is full of flavor without being overwhelming - particularly on the breath afterwards!  The servers were delightful, friendly, and efficient. The trifecta - Great food, great service, and affordable. A complete hit! I will be back, probably today!
author: Karla S.

description: Hands down my favorite Pho place in the city. I never craved pho before until I tried this place. I always get the number 34, five spice chicken pho and it never disappoints. Huge portions, super tasty broth, the chicken has such awesome flavor. Friendly wait staff, too. They will continue to get my business!
author: Dana J.

description:
Food was delicious. Service very disappointing! On a cold San Francisco evening, the staff kept propping the door open. Several different customers, including me, got up to close it over and over. It was cold & very hard to enjoy your dinner when you're cold!

After I closed it the server came over to tell me that it was hot in the kitchen. Basically the chef was hot so everyone else had to suffer. Actually reprimanded me for making myself more comfortable! Unbelievable. I was so shocked I said "It seems like you should be more concerned about the comfort of your customers" but the server just starred blankly and left.

The staff opening the door and customers closing it went on for at least 1/2 hour- probably longer - but we left.

I won't be back. I have no interest in spending my money at a restaurant that has so little interest in my experience!
author: Whitney T.

description:
Worst ever Bun Bo Hue!!!!!  Judging on the pictures Yelpers uploaded, I was hoping I would get a pretty decent bowl here.  I've been to many places specializing in this noodle soup in Garden Grove, San Jose, and yes Vietnam! 
So here's what happen.  I was promptly seated.  I looked at the menu and found the soup and ordered it by name. I had to point to it, cuz they had this confused look, like I really wanted that soup?? Fine!!! I don't want them to screw it up.   Within a minute, I given a fork:). .... Seriously !!! I'm over this!! I really need to ask why Chinese people really think certain South East Asian cultures...  can't use one, or prefer a fork.  My suggestion to Chinese restaurant employees..  WHY DONT YOU ASK YOU ignorant &!&$&$!!??&&@!!!!  Believe me... It won't offend us!! It's way bétter than profiling!! I have to admit I was not feeling great that night and so I thought a bowl of soup would make me feel better.  

Ok up until that point, I really wasn't pissed or anything. There were chopsticks at the next table, I just grabbed them:).   Now comes the part where I am justified to to give this 1star review.  My soup was served and was ready to dig in.  I took one look at the bowl and it did not resemble Bun Bo Hue.  They left off so many ingrediantes, it might as well be Spicy Pho or or something else.  I started to look online at pictures of the soup people raved about on Yelp.  I looked at the menu again to make sure I didn't get something else. I started to eat a bit cuz I was so hungry, but after a minute I asked the waiter if this was Bun Bo Hue... He had to get someone else, cuz he obviously could not speak English, really I don't care about wether he could or could not.   The other waiter explained to me that they took many of the ingrediants out because only Asians prefer them!!!!!.. WWWWTTTTTTFFFFF!!!!!  Another employee came over and we had a "discussion":). She offered to correct my order, so I gave her back my soup, but instead of bringing me a new order , she just microwaved the missing ingrediants in another bowl and brought it to me!!! NICE!!! Very NICE!!!!!! THey still forgot the Pork Hock/knuckle... Pretty much the MAIN ingrediant!!  
Well.. The side of Veggies was all wrong as well ..  It was for pho, they serve it, I know they do, people uploaded pics of the cabbage as well..  

They said the next time I cone it they will remember that I want it "Asian Style"...  Ohhh Sooo Funnyyy!!
author: Demanding T.

description:
I consider myself a tough pho critic and this place is another so-so in the city. Noodles are stuck together in the bottom of the bowl and broth is ok. Cleanliness and good service? Good. 

Will I come back? I tend to since I work so close by and my co-workers really like this place, I guess it will give me opportunities to sample different items.
author: Johanna P.

description: Stopped in this place for a cheap hot dinner and was impressed with the quality and quantity of food they give you for such a good price! The BBQ pork sandwich was delicious- the waitstaff recommended it and I couldn't have been happier with my choice. The sandwich was still steaming hot when I got home (I ordered it to-go), the bread was soft and crusty, and the vegetables were fresh. Great little spot in the Richmond- I'll definitely be back!
author: Kaya C.

description:
What a gem!  My friend Lara and I stumbled on this Inner Richmond dining spot on a Sunday evening while looking for some Pho to devour.  When we arrived, there wasn't a seat to be found, but the wait list was short.  The dual-purposed hostess/server seated us within 5 minutes, and placed a pot of hot tea in front of us as we were seated - very welcome on a chilly night.  The menu is extensive, and is comprised of the usual suspects in your typical Vietnamese restaurant: pho, rice plates, vermicelli noodles, etc.  The waitress was very pleasant and did not try to oversell, in fact, she told us we may be ordering too much and suggested that we scale down a bit, which we did, and yes, she was right.  Our order of spring rolls arrived shortly after we placed our order.  The rolls were fresh.  The sauce was a good texture and very flavorful.  The pho arrived as we finished the last bite of our spring rolls.  We both ordered the same thing: rare steak with beef balls.  The usual accompaniments: citrus wedges, bean sprouts, basil, peppers, and cilantro were all very fresh and complemented the hot bowl of pho.  The broth was clear, flavorful, and the noodles were perfect, not sticky at all.

I'm a fan, and I'll be back.  The food, and service were great.  The two bowls of pho and the spring rolls put us back only $24 - what a bargain!  

I wish I would have asked our server her name, she was great!  If management reads this, we were seated at the last long table in the back of the restaurant on 11/16/2014 - kudos to our delightful server!
author: Kristin R.

description:
Wanted to give this new place in the neighborhood a try. I've been to the Yummy Yummy in Inner Sunset before but never had the noodles there, only the family style dinners. Arrived here at 12 on a Sunday afternoon and had to wait in line. This place is popping! Waited around 20 minutes. The clip board for the queue is kinda pointless. 

Inside seated around 20-35 people. The place was clean. The ambiance was all Vietnamese, with pictures of Vietnam on the wall and video's of the country. Vietnamese music also playing in the background. I believe most of the workers there were Chinese/Viet. 

My party of 4 ordered the bun bo hue (something I've always been hesitant to try because restuarant grade bun bo hue is never good and in SF it would be dismal), the five spice chicken vermicelli, and  rice plate, and some spring rolls. They were very busy and the service was the usual asian flare, business oriented and trying to flip tables as fast as possible. They forgot my sister's dish and did nothing to compensate for it aside for removing it from the bill. The food overall was just ok to me. The bun bo made me nauseous which is unusual for me. 

Overall I'm glad new businesses are popping up and I welcome this place to keep up the competition for good Vietnamese food which is rare in SF. This place is decent but if I had to drive somewhere to eat, I'd go to downtown or Loi's in Inner RIchmond for food.
author: Nam L.

description: Love the Banh Mi, egg rolls are delicious and so is the Pho. Check it out. It's for some people and for some it's not.
author: Jamie S. R.

description:
phosho the best pho in the pho game. #28.
pork sando is tight too. B.
I fucts with this place.
author: Louie L.

description: Finally getting around to posting a review of my go-to cheap viet food establishment.  The menu has a broad selection and they arguably serves the best vermicelli in town!    There's not a ton of seating but we rarely have to wait for a table and the staff is prompt and friendly.  So thankful for this location north of the park where I can get my weekly fix in.
author: Sean T.

description: Subpar food with subpar service. Got the Bun Bo Hue. it was pretty terrible. Little meat and noodles. Took along time to take our order. Took along time to get our check. Never going again
author: Leon K.

description: If you crave delicious and authentic Vietnamese food at reasonable prices, this place is a must try. I don't have any complaints.
author: Alex U.

description: The location is very convenient to me and the only thing I really get here is the bun bo hue. I've try the pho and its the same as every other place. There may be a better place to get bun bo hue but for my convenience this place does the job and satisfy my hunger.
author: Thommy V.

description: Had to try this place since one of my good friends lives a few blocks away. The food was good, but nothing extraordinarily remarkable. I had the steak Pho, their broth was cloudy, at all other Pho places I've tried the broth is clear, it was still tasty though.  I would come back but I would never wait to be seated.
author: Eric G.

description: I pretty much love this place. I usually go for vegetarian Pho, which some people give me a hard time for since I am not in fact a vegetarian, but it's my favorite kind of Pho. Almost every Vietnamese place has it, but that doesn't mean it's very good. The veggie Pho here is good! Better than most for sure. Overall the place seems cleaner than a lot of other similar restaurants around and that is important to me. Love their spring rolls and imperial rolls too!
author: Amy S.

description: The husband and I wanted Pho and we were going to head to Yummy Yummy in the Sunset as it is our favorite place, but this place was closer. Upon our arrival, and to our surprise, this was a Yummy Yummy location too! That means they had chicken broth, YAY! This place is smaller with a super friendly staff too. Better for a date night for sure. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 1) Their vegetable mix for the soup doesn't have mushrooms and 2) they didn't have garlic ready on the table like Yummy Yummy, but I asked for it and it was received. Really this is a 4.5 star review but hey, it's Yelp and they like round stars.
author: Kat M.

description: Omg yes!!!! Thats all i have to say. So cheap and incredible. Highlights: five spice chicken soup, bbq pork fresh rolls and vegetarian bahn me. I srsly love this place.
author: David B.

description: This place lost a star because it took forever for our orders to come out. My sister finished her Banh beo before our orders came out -___-. We had to ask the waiter where it was and THEN he brought out all three orders. Aside from that, everything was good! Prices aren't too bad but the portions are much smaller than their sister restaurant YUMMY YUMMY. I had the bun bo hue which has such a flavorful soup! I wanted to drink the entire bowl! It is a bit spicy but it's such a good spicy! My mom has the Banh canh cua which is a thicker soup base but not bad. Had crab and it is in season right now, so yum! Then my boyfriend had pho, didn't get to try that but he enjoyed it. My sisters Banh beo was a bit salty but the sauce helped it a bit. We also ordered beef carpaccio for our appetizer. It had exactly 8 pieces so everyone got 2 pieces before our meals. This was delicious! I really like their fish sauce! Total was $45 for  4 people so not bad! Will definitely be back :)
author: Amanda C.

description: Their chicken pho is a delicious bargain! The broth is super flavorful and they're generous with the fixins on the side.
author: Melanie S.

description: Very good soup and quick, efficient and pleasant service make this a must for take aways in our house.
author: Marc P.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night and the place was about half full.  I've been to solid Vietnamese places down in Orange County and decided to give this place a try.  First off, plus for having the USC-Notre Dame football game on (more of a bonus point).  

As for the food, I tried the Five Spice Chicken (their house specialty) with vermicelli.  The chicken was juicy and it had a good flavor to it (not spicy at all, more of a peppery taste).  The chicken rested on the vermicelli, shredded carrots, some lettuce and sprouts.  Next, I had some Pho with rare steak.  It came in a good size bowl with the normal fixings (sprouts, peppers, basil, cilantro, onions, and lemons -- not limes).  I'm personally more of a fan of pho with lime juice, but that' okay.  Each dish was about $8 which I find reasonable.

All in all, it was a worthy, reasonably-priced dinner!
author: Kevin L.

description: My very first pho...AH-mazing! The broth is just the right amount of salty-ness. I absolutely loved it. I also recommend the BBQ pork spring rolls. The San Francisco natives that take me here say this place has the best pho in the city.
author: Nicole M.

description: Very good pho along with fast service I am from out of town and I was looking for something to remind me of home and we did a little research and found this place good pho fast service winning combination would recommend
author: Victor R.

description: Pretty good overall, above average.  Usually enjoy five spice chicken though at times it's a bit dry and not very moist. However, it's fairly nicely prepared. Imperial roll is a good choice, service can be even better, but at least I think you won't be really disappointed by this place.
author: Michelle K.

description:
If you've been to Yummy Yummy in Inner Sunset, then these are the same folks bringing that same Vietnamese goodness to the Inner RIchmond. The owner is extremely chatty and helpful and you can tell he truly cares about his customers and food. 

The menu is pretty much a 8 page laminated book of sorts and even includes advertisements. The offering is your standard Viet variety with Pho, rice dishes, vermicelli and appetizers with a lot of additional hard-to-find favorites as well. We had the Bo Bia rolls, Bun Bo Hue and Banh Hoi with pork and all 3 were flavorful, but slightly smaller than I would have expected. 

All in all, a good quick meal with friendly service in a good location.
author: Julie T.

description:
We decided to come hear since the other Vietnamese place we love in the hood is a bit far (everything within 15 blocks from where we live is considered the neighborhood, lol).

We've had the fresh spring rolls (the roll-your-own fare), the five spice chicken and the beef lemongrass BBQ phos and the Vietnamese crepe.  The people seem to have recognized us already that they smile at us even when we see them on the street.
author: Ai S.

description: This place is just ok. Five spice chicken was dry and very salty. Bun bo hue was not good. Nothing compared to San Jose. I'm not coming back. Nothing special and I've been to better.
author: Larry L.

description: 5 stars for service!!! Especially the taller gentleman with glasses. Food is always good and consistent. Love coming here.
author: Cray C.

description: The combo pho #25 featuring slices of beef and balls of beef was just the comforting lunch prescription on this blah-yuk-gloomy-semi-rainy-afternoon in the Richmond District. The broth was tasty and sweet and the noodle portions were just right. Nice clean establishment, and friendly service.
author: Derek N.

description: I had an epiphany last night when I was here. All Vietnamese food that I have ever had has been pretty standard. Nothing wowing me and nothing saying ewww that was awful. We got the spring rolls and papaya salad to start. The salad was pretty good, the rolls were also tasty with a hint of spice, the peanut sauce however lacked big time. One little knock. I got the Spicy Chicken Curry and rice and stepmom got the Beef Ball Pho, good reports from me on the spicy cury, pretty spicy, but not overly done. Tea and good prices are always a standard at the Vietnamese places and this place was right on par. Good neighborhood place to come for a quick tasty bite.
author: Ezra B.

description: Super hole in the wall, always a wait, and you sit about 2 inches away from the stranger next to you... but so worth it! Broth is incredible, excellent carbs to protein ratio, and meat is so tender! Y & Y and Yummy Yummy (could they possibly be related somehow?!?!?!) are my go-to pho places in the city.
author: Shawna C.

description: Good enough. Light on the flavor so order something spicy. Very good coffee and reasonable prices. ~$7-8 for a bowl of pho.
author: Katya B.

description:
I have been dreaming of Vietnamese food all week and Yummy Yummy did not disappoint. We both ordered the five-spice chicken with vermicelli and spring rolls, and for less then $8 each we left happy and full. The service was very friendly and fast, and they were more than happy to answer any of our questions. This would be a great place to bring friends, and if you are on a very tight budget like we are this place really does give you a lot of bang for you buck.

Honestly, we liked it so much we plan on going again tomorrow.
author: Elena B.

description: Found this Inner Richmond restaurant on Yelp.  It received good reviews so I thought we'd try since I was craving Pho!  We ordered spring rolls & imperial rolls - both were decent.  The pho was actually really good.  And bonus was that I wasn't super thirsty after.  The ambiance is nicer then your typical Vietnamese restaurant but it's on the smaller side.  It was crowded at all times on a Sunday evening during dinner.  Y for yummy!
author: Meredith K.

description: Enjoy coming here once a week or so after work.  Really enjoy their bbq pork sandwich.  When it's icy cold, you know, during the Summer, I love a bowl of their bun bo hue.  It's so very good and spicy.
author: Patrick W.

description: Love this place. Friendly service great food. These people giving one and two stars below are the problem with yelp. People who were probably picked on in elementary school now want to get all righteous ... To them I say go back to San Jose
author: chris k.

description: This place is legit. Good pho, good vermicelli bowls, good fresh/fried rolls. Cheap prices, quick service, clean restaurant. This is the sister spot of the one in the sunset. So glad they are on the block now.
author: J S.

description: This place is a new chain of yummy yummy on Irving. Pretty good food! The portions were satisfying (pho) but the appetizer portion was poor and could be a lot better. A buck or two more than pho places like Kevin's, but just as good. They are both equivalent in taste to me, so I'll just stick to Kevin's. (Not sure which is better since I don't have pho very often).
author: Alyssa Z.

description: Just like their sister restaurant (Yummy Yummy on Irving)...always a pleasure eating here.  Their Bo Tai Chahn is always fresh and priced reasonably.  Pho is always up-too-par and so is their 3-color or 5-color rice plates.  I just wonder if their crab is as good as Yummy Yummy?  Or do they even serve crabs at this location??  Hmmm...something i must find out soon...
author: Patrick C.

description: I have to admit, the first time I ate here I was not impressed but after a few times I am all warmed up. Food's really good. We had the five spiced chicken fresh roll plate (you make your own) and a grilled pork rice plate, and the rice cakes. Aside from the rice cake which has almost next to no taste but does come with a yummy dipping sauce, everything tasted really good.
author: Missy X.

description: Best Pho in town. Awesome chicken wings in lemongrass with garlic and soy. Reasonable, good service, and very clean.
author: Sean J.

description: Sometimes, it's hard to find good Viet food in San Francisco, which surprises me.  We found this place while scrounging Clement St. for a pho restaurant. I wish we could have ordered more, but we got the banh uot dac biet as an appetizer, and a bowl of pho each.  The banh uot was great, and the pho was awesome. I'm definitely coming back to try the other dishes.  The bowls were huge, which made me very happy! Definitely a good place to go if you're hungry.
author: Vero K.

description: I am so happy Yummy Yummy now has a sister restaurant on Clement. It is casual and cheap but the ambiance is still cute and the bathroom is clean. We ordered five spice chicken pho, which was excellent. The flavoring was delicious and the chicken and the noodles were cooked to perfection. We also had the papaya shrimp salad, which was so good. Portion sizes are large, but not huge. And the service was friendly and fast too. Yummy yummy!
author: Natasha F.

description: Pretty awful. Spring rolls took 10 minutes to come out. We ordered grilled chicken and grilled pork. The pork took over 30 minutes to come out and the chicken, over 35. When the chicken came out it was fried, not grilled. We asked about why it took so long an they gave us some bs excuse about the pork taking a long time to grill, but then it came out first? Not sure why this place was so packed if our experience was exemplary of a typical meal here. I'm pretty sure it goes without saying that we won't be back.
author: Seth S.

description: The pho is amazing, the broth is rich and flavorful, and the atmosphere is charmingly unfussy. The vegetarian spring rolls were good, and a bit unusual: the vegetables were lightly sautéed, which made them tasty but a little bit oily, too. But with pho this good, you don't need anything else.
author: Michael B.

description: Just as good as Yummy Yummy over on Irving. Y&Y is closer to my house, so we tend to come here more often than Yummy Yummy. The pho is great and have also heard great things about their sandwiches.
author: Taylor B.

description: Had a vietnamese sandwich here. The price is average, the sandwich was not better than Little Vietnam Cafe on 6th and Clement St. I did take out and it took for ever to get the order... Maybe they were busy... Anyways, not enough info to really judge this restaurant, but if you are in for a vietnamese sandwich, I would rather go to Little Vietnam Cafe!
author: David L.

description:
I live locally. I have eaten at every Vietnamese place on clement between arguello and 30th - and most on Geary. 

Takeout: pho tai nam and bun thit nuong cha gio. 

Pho: disappointing. While the eye round is of easily the highest quality I've ever had in SF, the flank was so so. Worse the overall quantity of food was truly about half of what you'd get elsewhere. It would have been comical if it were not so disappointing. I are a large bowl of cereal after this meal. Thats not normal. Finally, the broth seemed like it was built on a mushroom base. Truly odd. 

Pho: 3/5, would be 4/5 if it were a normal-sized portion. 

Bun: the spring roll is always the first impression, and unfortunately it did set the tone - fine but bland. Quality of meat was again a high point, but the whole dish just lacked anything to distinguish itself. 

Bun: 3/5

The consensus on this place is so positive that I may try it again while eating in, but my first experience was so underwhelming that it will probably be a whole before I give them a second chance.
author: r g.

description: Torn between 3 and 4; gave it a 4 due to Chicken Wings (the sauce is seriously over the top!!!) - the Pho is "ok" - same owner as Y&Y on Clement (met him too - SUPER nice guy!!!) - really can't say enough about the chicken wings...not something to take to go, must be eaten on site as if left in the sauce for TOO long can make them a bit soggy...that said, still worth repeat performances!
author: Richard D.

description: Probably my favorite Vietnamese food place in the city. Quick, delicious and the people are super nice. Barbecue pork spring rolls and charbroiled steak vermicelli are amazing, but the classic Pho ga does the trick too.
author: Chancelor D.

description:
Have only been there for lunch, not dinner or take out. The noodles in the pho are always fresh and not too soft or brittle. Their five spice chicken is very good and they use good quality beef for this noodle soup.

I would give them 5 stars, except that there is one waitress who on a couple of occasions was not super friendly (no smile and appeared impatient)
author: Raul G.

description: The curry chicken with bread is awesome! Try it people!!!
author: Niko L.

description: aaaah what can I say other than, Yummy Yummy is so YUMMY YUMMY!!! I love their viet taco, Chicken Wings is a must try, Beef Carpaccio is freakin delicious. This is a totally a regular spot for me and my friends. So glad they opened a 2nd location here :)
author: Arlene R.

description: Great addition to the Clement Street food scene - it's cheap and they take credit cards. Not quite as cheap as the Pho over in the Inner Sunset but still a good deal. Their satay beef pho is good but has a distinct peanut taste just fyi. I had the curry chicken pho and it was good but I preferred the basic beef (tai) pho when I had it. The restaurant was full on a Sunday night which is a good sign. I still have to try some of the other dishes but everything has been good so far and the dishes I saw on other people's tables looked great.
author: Jennifer R.

description: Outstanding customer service and the food is was good and filling. The seasonings such as the amount of oil, sauces and other condiment levels are always at the right level and it seems like not many Vietnamese restaurants can achieve that. I always come back here for more and would recommend this place to any person that enjoys pho or any sorts of Vietnamese dishes.
author: Will F.

description: I have been to this place 4-5 times now and came away satisfied each time. It offers a lot of choices, ranging from Pho, salads and many traditional Vietnamese entrees. The sandwiches are delicious and toasted perfectly. My children came to visit during Cgristmas time and kept on going back for the grilled pork sandwiches. It is now my favorite Vietnamese restaurant for casual dinner/lunch.
author: Tuck W.

description: This place is so good! I was going to another Vietnamese place on Irving but my BF and I stumbled upon this place while on Clement. The service is great and the food is awesome! We went twice this weekend because it was so good!  I liked the five spice chicken but still prefer the charbroiled pork. I can't wait to go back!
author: Michelle A.

description: The five spice chicken noodle soup was comforting, and the jackfruit milkshake a delight. The service was friendly without being overbearing. I liked that I received extra fish sauce for my noodle salad upon request without any fuss. Foodbeard and I enjoyed our dine-in experience.
author: Rose Q.

description: Great find on Clement , had the PHO TAI... service was prompt and place was bright and clean... I was use to Clement St Pho down on 3rd and this place is a nicer down the street. Broth was slightly sweet and noodles were nice fresh sprouts/ extras.... will definitely return.... I think this place is new to the street. As a final note it was nice as I left the server and bus person both said, "THANK YOU" .... Looking forward to trying more on the menu
author: Sam B.

description: Solid local go-to spot for regular Vietnamese fare.  Their Pho is above average.  Their grilled pork is highly recommended.  Staff is very friendly and attentive.  This place is consistently busy which says alot.  See alot of repeat customers as well (including my friends and I).  Check it out for some quality Vietnamese.
author: Tom L.

description: Y&Y is terrific. Great pho and barbecue pork rolls, quick service and a great price. We go here frequently for an easy dinner on a weeknight.  It's a neighborhood gem and absolutely excellent!
author: Nav K.

description: Bland food.  Even the house dipping sauce (not rooster sauce) was bland.  Don't know what the hype is about because we had to wait almost half hour for our a table on a Wednesday night.  There are plenty of decent Vietnamese restaurants on Clement.
author: Swati K.

description: Excellent Imperials rolls, excellent bun bo, cheap, clean, best vietmanese sandwiches I have ever tired !!! I love this place.
author: Jenna M.

description: Service was good. I ordered Chicken Pho and found the chicken to be really fatty and gristly:(  Pretty bummed may give them one more try
author: Alex A.

description: YUM. We used to eat at Mai's, but after reading about their poor choice in a new chef, we decided to try somewhere new. We tried barbecue pork summer rolls, pho bo, pho bo with meatballs, and bun cha with barbecue pork and spring rolls. Wonderfully seasoned sauces and broth, and fresh herbs. Helpful, friendly staff (who even humored our attempts at Vietnamese conversation).
author: Kelly G.

description: They have one of my all time favorites here... banh beo. Not a lot of restaurants make it! I usually have to wait til I get back home to the parents before I can eat this. It's simply delish! Yuuuuum
author: Lola D.

description: "if i can give this place zero stars i would" A line that many people have saidon yelp, but this place truly deserve ZERO stars. My girlfriend i live in the richmond and figured we would order in. So we ordered through eat 24 and picked a restaurant within the area, thinking that the delivery would take less than an hour. BUT NO I WAS WRONG, it took over an hour!! When we checked the eat24 app, it said that it had been delivered So i called the restaurant to find out what was going on, but the lady on the phone was nothing rude and unhelpful. She kept saying that the delivery person is gone and was on the way. When i tried to ask  her why they set my delivery as delivered, when it was clearly not delivered, she hung up me!!! We ordered two bowls of pho and fried chicken wings..THE CHICKEN WINGS WERE SOGGY AND COLD! The pho ( which tasted like can soup ) was cold and really salty. I suggest people who want good vietnamese food and also want it delivered...NOT TO ORDER FROM THIS PLACE! There alot of other places !   This is truly a poor excuse of a restaurant.
author: R S.

description: This is actually a really good Vietnamese food restaurant. The people who run this place are friendly, and you can tell they care about the quality of the food they make as well as the service they provide... definitely one of the better Vietnamese restaurants in SF..
author: Yuan T.

description: I love bun bo Hue... But i don't love the places i need to go to get it (ie.. Tenderloin, Chinatown, San Jose) this spot is close to where I live and quite clean. Service is always excellent. Minus one star cause i still think the other places in TL, C-town, and SJ are better.
author: Cliff L.

description: Was so happy to find this place two blocks from my house is run by the same folks as Yummy Yummy over in the sunset. Great food and service.
author: dan m.

description:
i know this is related to yummy yummy on irving.
but the pho isn't as good - very 1note, no shallots, no complexity to the broth.
not as big either.
but the bun & seafood pho  - both excellent.
also - i know fluorescent lighting is de rigeur @ these places, but the greenish tint in the front is just too MUCH.
author: Kim Y.

description: This new restaurant is my favorite Yummy Yummy's sister restaurant.  In addition to my addiction to their pho's, I'm falling for their great desserts in this new sister location.  Gotta try them all!
author: Mrs P.

description: the place is small and cozy and staff seems friendly.  prices aren't bad but definitely smaller in size.  banh mi is tasty and hk milk tea has pretty good tea taste but both seriously small in size.  price compare to value is about 2 1/2 star, taste is about 3 1/2 star.
author: Food Is L.
